means: （因寒冷，害怕等）颤抖，哆嗦( shiver的现在分词 )

word_mean: 战栗：肌肉收缩引起的不随意颤抖，人类及动物生理性产热方法
一种马病，以各种肌肉颤抖为特征
感觉寒冷的同时伴有全身不由自主的颤抖的表现。

sentence.Network_en: You're shivering fit to die, Gracie.
He was so cold that he kept shivering.

定位点上升厉害的时候,会出现寒颤 (shivering) 现象以增加热量,并且周边的血管收缩以减少热量丧失, 于是会出现四肢冰冷. 2.体温过.
he stood shivering on the brink , waiting to dive in ., 他站在边上等待跳水时浑身发抖.

entry.tran: (因寒冷或惧怕而)哆嗦，颤抖，发抖
entry.def: When you shiver, your body shakes slightly because you are cold or frightened.

example.ex: I was sitting on the floor shivering with fear.
example.tran: 我坐在地板上，吓得发抖。

means.word_mean: 1. a sensation of cold that often marks the start of an infection and the development of a fever
1. vibrating slightly and irregularly; as e.g. with fear or cold or like the leaves of an aspen in a breeze;

sentences.sentence: "sparkling light from the shivering crystals of the chandelier"
